thread.title: Police make arrest in January hit-and-run
thread.title_full: Police make arrest in January hit-and-run

author: holly.hays@indystar.com
title: Police make arrest in January hit-and-run
text:
Police make arrest in January hit-and-run Holly V. Hays , holly.hays@indystar.com 10:14 p.m. ET Feb. 9, 2017 Brittney Jones (Photo: Provided by IMPD) 87 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Indianapolis Metropolitan Police have arrested a suspect believed to have been involved in a January fatal hit-and-run crash. 
Just after 7 p.m. on Jan. 13, officers with the IMPD and Lawrence Police Department were dispatched to the 7300 block of Pendleton Pike on reports of a pedestrian struck, according to a news release. 
At the scene, officers found an unresponsive man, later identified as 52-year-old Brian Wilkinson of Anderson, Ind., in the road. He was taken to Methodist Hospital, where he later died. 
Investigators were able to identify a suspect using tips from residents who had seen the story on the news, according to police. 
Investigators were granted an arrest warrant for 30-year-old Brittney Jones on Feb. 3 for her alleged involvement in the accident. She was arrested Thursday on a preliminary charge of leaving the scene of an accident causing death. 
Jones is scheduled to appear in court for an initial hearing on Feb. 13, according to online court records. 
Call IndyStar reporter Holly Hays at (317) 444-6156. Follow her on Twitter: @hollyvhays. Read or Share this story: http://indy.st/2k9OyQq TOP VIDEOS
